title: Does anyone else hate playing against Fizz?
body:
Not a QQ thread but...

I can't lie, It's super freaking frustrating when you use your Ultimate as whatever champion you are playing and he goes all "lol nope", and being able to do it again in 5 seconds if he has max CDR.

replies.body:
Come on guys you gotta learn to bait that shit (he's a fish for Chris'sake, they love bait). Play Ori into him and say goodbye to that stupid little fish. 

You have to remember the psychology of Fizz players. They think they're godlike because they play a super difficult champion. So you have to use that against them (kinda like Zed). You gotta butter them up in /all chat. Saying stuff like, "Oh wow this is a tough matchup". When they make a decent play (aka the only play Fizz makes, Q/W in and E out, super difficult amirite?) you have to congratulate them. 

And then. When the time is right. You end that fishing trip with a Q->W->R combo. Haha, screw Fizz.
Got it, will continue to counterpick him in blind pick.

Bait a skill with 5 second CD.
Got it.
It's only that low lategame. During the laning phase he's vulnerable every time he's forced to use it because he automatically loses his ability to safely trade and escape ganks for a while.

He wouldn't be so much of a problem if point-and-click hard CC wasn't so rare anymore in the game. The way you counter annoyingly mobile champions is with targetted hard-CC. The problem is, {{champion:105}} now goes top lane building full tank so even if you can hard-CC him there's no guarantee he will die. He will go in, kill your squishy, and come out unscathed or (if you hard-CC him for a bit) partially scathed.
Honestly ap fizz isn't even that big of a deal to me anymore. Sometimes I do get irritated by the bruiser fizz build tho.

Does anybody _not_ hate playing against Fizz?

I don't mind it, but then again I don't mind playing vs yas, riven, etc. They keep me on my toes and force me to try to play better, generally ending up in myself having a better game then I normally do.

Kinda the same boat for me. Though, I also play Fizz, so I tend to know when to be more careful and when to be more aggressive. Every time I lane against a Fizz he has a really bad time, similar to when someone knows about Fizz and I'm playing against him, my laning phase will not be a good time. Ah, well. So it goes.

He trades one spell for one, the key is to play someone with cheap harass so the trade costs you less than it does him.

Ori, Teemo, Talon, Ahri, Diana are good picks.

Regardless, opening the combo with your ult is not recommendable. Everyone can dash out of it, not just Fizz.
Fizz would rip Teemo and Diana apart any day of the week.
Diana absolutely shits on Fizz

yea Tanky mid laners tend to counter fizz like {{champion:12}} {{champion:131}} {{champion:31}} {{champion:3}} {{champion:25}} {{champion:13}} {{champion:90}} {{champion:90}} {{champion:90}} {{champion:90}} {{champion:90}} {{champion:90}}  NERF MALZ BUFF FIZZ

Malz is very skill-based, if Fizz lands his Ult on you then you won't be able to get your full ult on him because of the knock-up. He's also got fair odds of hitting you and troll-poling away before you can react; not perfect odds, but decent if you have even a little lag.

Ori: You need to be very good in shoving the lane and harassing. A good Ori can deal with him if she use her utility perfectly

Temmo: If you want to win forget him. He is fish food.

Talon: Fizz just outtrade him i don't recommend him. And reveal his stealth.

Ahir: She can do pretty well vs Fizz. Mobile enough to survive his all-in, and can poke him down. Maybe the best meta pick vs Fizz

Diana: Same as Talon. If Fizz don't missplay or you don't outplay him he will win.

If he's in the air while the ground is burning, he should not take damage, no?
Except that the ability being refereed to is not just the ground burning, it's a geyser of flames.
Yeah it never made sense that hopping on a delicately balanced trident made you immune to a tsunami, or a flying dragon, or a barrage of cannonballs bombarding the are.
Wasn't CLARITY a thing riot wanted to strenghten recently or am I missing something important here?
I'd rather fight a fizz over a few things, vayne for example is one of those things. Not to mention she can condemn fizz mid q -_-

At least with Vayne you can completely blow her up with a pink ward.

However you can't do anything about fizz's untargetability.
If you drop 2 pinks he becomes targetable
xD

Yep, regardless off if you think Fizz is OP or not, he's one of the most frustrating champions in the game to play against. His season 3/season 4 full ap burst in a blink of an eye and his new "ad/CDR" bruiser build is just a bad, except fizz is not squishy and is not easy to bring down.
Let's get one thing clear : Fizz was made with the intent of being annoying

As bad as it sounds... Fizz is probably the only champion that I'd dodge before laning against. Not play against in general, just if I know I'm going to be the one laning against him. My hate for him is probably more than it should be, but it's just there. If I can't ban him, I'll dodge before going into a game that I know will put me on auto-tilt the second I see him on the other side of the lane. Don't get me wrong. He's not the most overpowered champion in the game by any means -- He's just so frustrating to lane against and his ability to put me, and probably a LOT of people on tilt within' 5 minutes of a game is unmatched.

I think there's a word for that. Not overpowered, but, Toxic.

Toxic would mean that you have slowly decreased the amount of time that you play League because of Fizz existing as is. The game would be slowly dying to you. But you still play it.

It's not toxic, just annoying.
If that was the case, then none of us would be playing this game any more, since forget about champions, at least 7-10% of the *players* you meet are toxic.

That's why I silence him. {{champion:86}} 

Then he can't avoid Demacian Justice.

To be fair, I generally hate playing against any assassin.

The concept of assassins is just.. ugh.. They don't play assassin to win teamfights, they play assassins just so they can have a chance to completely rape you in lane for one mistake.
Everyone hates Fizz.  Even Fizz.  Behind that obnoxious smile is a ton of pent-up self loathing.
Jesus.... I would rather eat nails than play against Fizz.  He is sooooo annoying.  So safe.  Ridiculously anti fun to play against
Your name literally has the word "tuna" in it.  You would kind of expect his shark to eat you xD
I main Rengo, not a fish ;(
I would prefer a 5 man Teemo team over 1 Fizz.

Who DOESN'T hate playing against Fizz? His E shouldn't exist in this game. It's one of the reasons why I sometimes decide against playing; just in case I have a Fizz on the enemy team. That damn spell shouldn't exist in its current state.
When a champ that has 0 AD scaling has as his most popular build AD off tank, then you know something is wrong with that guy.

Not gonna lie, what bothers me most isn't how many ults he can make other people whiff, it's the fast that his own ult, even if he misses, sticks around and can still be picked up by a champion, _and still hits untargetable champions once attached to them._ What kind of double standard bullshit is that?

I find it kinda' annoying when I miss my ability because he uses his E, but I don't find him a huge pain or frustrating to deal with, and from time to time I'll play a Champion who he directly counters.

I'm assuming you mean primarily when going against him mid lane, but when I'm in a different lane, I feel he's about the same, and when he's jungling, he seems to do about the same things as he would do in mid lane.

I'm Bronze, though, so take that into consideration XD

Yorick makes the game less fun, while Fizz simply isn't fun to play against.. If that makes sense.

The fact that he's able to 100-0 you while taking no damage isn't fair. His troll-pole makes him not only invulnerable, but also deals damage when he lands..
Talk about an overloaded kit.

I hate playing against Yasuo for more or less the same reason - slippery as all hell, and with one spell can block all your damage

Baiting Windwall/Troll Pole is fun sometimes but it gets annoying when you have to play against them constantly >>

Zed and Riven to a lesser extent. I can't play as nor against them. xD
